page.title: 01Standish Plateau, SW Lancs
page.content: Mixed farming predominates. Farmers rear cattle for beef or dairy. Crops are mainly cereals. Much of other land cover is rough grassland or deciduous woodland. Residential areas tend to be ribbon development along the main A49 and along roads at the cross roads. Other developments are purpose built estates. NW Water Authority have a large reservoir development - Worthington Lakes, with public access for recreation and fishing. Also on this site Factory - Carrington Viyella linked to water supply being available. Two small industrial areas - Bradley Hall on Old Manor Site and Victoria based on old Coal Mine property. Village of Standish built on a plateau. Also area contains River Douglas valley and part of the Leeds/Liverpool Canal. Large country house - Haigh Hall and Country Park.
